comments.body: nit: when we put such large blocks within a try-finally block, do you think it would be useful to move the block to a separate private method, so they are more easy to read?
I guess in this case I don't believe that moving to a separate private method is that useful/beneficial.
The bulk of the changes in this class are indentation due to wrapping in a new try-catch.

Can we move these strings to a class property, perhaps as a public property on the Configuration class? Now that these metrics will be exposed with this pattern, systems reading this log may want to rely on this string format. Explicitly declaring this as a public constant may help prevent accidental breaking changes.
Can this be refactored into a separate helper method, considering this is the same (with minor variations) in all three client-related methods?

Add comment:
```
// Connector-specified overrides
```
here an in the other 2 methods, too.

Maybe add a comment above this line that says something like:
```
// These should be caught when the herder validates the connector configuration, but just in case
```
